page.title: 19ROSTHERNE CHURCH AND LEGEND
page.content: { { THE CHURCH, BEAUTIFULLY SITUATED {OVERLOOKING THE MERE,}SEEMS TOO BIG FOR SUCH A SMALL VILLAGE BUT IN THE PAST ROSTHERNE WAS THE MOTHER CHURCH FOR KNUTSFORD AND A LARGE PARISH. THE CHURCH WAS IN EXISTENCE BEFORE 1188 WITH{A STONE TOWER ADDED IN 1533. IT MAY HAVE BEEN THEN THAT THERE WAS TROUBLE WITH THE BELLS. ONE BELL KEPT SLIDING DOWN THE HILL AND A WORKMAN SAID 'I WOULD THE DEVIL HAD THEE';THE BELL ROLLED OVER HIM AND INTO THE LAKE, GIVING RISE TO THE {LEGEND}THAT EVERY YEAR AT EASTER A MERMAID SWIMS UP FROM THE SEA BY SUBTERRANEAN PASSAGES TO RING THE BELL.AN UNLIKELY TALE BUT{SMELT, A SALT WATER FISH}HAVE BEEN CAUGHT IN THE MERE WHICH IS UNUSUALLY DEEP, ABOUT 30 METERS. THE COAT OF ARMS OF THE MERE FAMILY OF MERE HAD A CREST SHOWING A MERMAID.
